summary: This document is an email chain between US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing a spreadsheet ('Bookl.xlsx') related to the case US v. Epstein. The correspondence clarifies the count of individuals notified of a hearing, noting a discrepancy between 43 listed and 39 actually notified.

events.title: Email discussion about hearing notification list
events.description: US Attorney's Office personnel exchange emails regarding a spreadsheet for US v. Epstein, specifically discussing a discrepancy in the number of individuals notified of a hearing (43 listed vs. 39 notified).

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain within the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
It references a spreadsheet file named 'Bookl.xlsx' pertaining to the case US v. Epstein.
The correspondence centers on clarifying a discrepancy: 43 individuals are listed under 'notify' in the spreadsheet, but only 39 were actually notified of a hearing.
The email chain dates to October 31, 2019.
